snippet.title: Brain Break -Scavenger Hunt
snippet.description:
Scavenger Hunt
I will give you 3 separate lists with items that you generally will have in and around your house.
The lists will pop up on the screen for 10 second and then you will have to see if you can find the items in under 3 minutes per list.
What do you need?
Plastic container or a basket. Any container will do, it does not need to be a big container.
And then a stopwatch. You will use the stopwatch to time yourself. You will have 3 minutes to complete a list.

You will have 10 sec to view a list that will pop up on screen. After 10 sec the screen will turn red and you will have to press pause.
Once you press pause you will start your stopwatch.
You then go on your 1st scavenger hunt. You have 3 minutes to complete the list. If you can’t find an item in under 3 minutes, don’t worry you will be able to look for that item during the other 2 hunts.
After 3 minutes you must return to your screen and press play so view your 2nd list.
Feel free to ask you parents for help as 3 minutes is a short time.
Repeat the process. In total there is 15 items on the lists. You score will be the total number of items that you have in your container/ basket at the end of the video.

Well done and I hope you found all the items on the lists
Remember to like this video and subscribe to our channel.

snippet.description:
Online Class for Kids #27 by The Learning Station (Also known as Learning Station) and sung by Don Monopoli: Welcome to The Learning Station’s online/virtual classroom for children. Here is a list of the action, dance, brain breaks, movement, exercise and fun learning songs we will be performing today: 
❤It's Showtime (Movement and Brain Breaks Song for Kids.)
❤Old MacDonald (Animal Sing Along Song for Kids.)
❤Bean Bag Boogie (Brain Breaks, Movements with a Bean Bag Song.)
❤ What Color is This? (Color Song for Kids.)
**************************************************************************
❤ SUBSCRIBE to The Learning Station's YouTube channel today! : https://www.youtube.com/user/TheLearningStation

It's Showtime by The Learning Station and sung by Don Monopoli, is a great brain breaks action, dance song to make it easy and fun to take a quick energy break.  When children take a moment to sing, dance and move then they can return to their academics feeling happy, energized and renewed. Schools are realizing the significant values of brain breaks in the classroom. This brain breaks dance song is perfect for preschoolers, kindergarten, elementary and physical education.

Hello everybody, I’m with The Learning Station
and we’re going on a rock n’ roll journey. 
So please stand up. Get on your feet, feel the rhythm. 
There’s lots of different ways you can move to the beat. 
Now shake, shake it with your head now, shake, 
shake it with your head now, shake, shake it with your head, now. 
Lots of different ways you can move to the beat. 
Now wiggle, wiggle with your shoulders, wiggle, 
wiggle with your shoulders, wiggle, wiggle with your shoulders. 
Lots of different ways you can move to the beat. 
Now clap, clappin’ with your hands now, clap, 
clappin’ with your hands now clap, clappin’ with your hands, now. 
Lots of different ways you can move to the beat. 
Now snap, snappin’ with your fingers, snap, 
snappin’ with your fingers, snap, snappin’ with your fingers. 
Lots of different ways you can move to the beat. 
Now twist, twistin’ with your hips now twist, 
twistin’ with your hips now twist, twistin’ with your hips now. 
Lots of different ways you can move to the beat. 
Now stamp, stamping with your feet now, stamp, 
stamping with your feet now stamp, stamping with your feet, now.
Lots of different ways you can move to the beat. 
Now shake, shake your whole body, shake, 
shake your whole body, shake, shake your whole body. 
Lots of different ways you can move to the beat. 
Hello everybody, I’m with The Learning Station 
and we’re going on a rock n’ roll journey.

snippet.title: Kids Yoga #1, Online Resources, Physical Education, DPA, Brain Breaks, Exercise, Health, Wellness
snippet.description:
Get the Flash-Cards Here!! https://www.teacherspayteachers.com/Product/Yoga-Flash-Cards-Physical-Literacy-PE-5905923

Take a break with your students and practice Yoga with this easy to follow video!!

(8 Mins)

During this video, students are expected to follow the yoga poses that are shown on the screen. Each movement activity will last for 40 seconds before changing. The music in the video will motivate and inspire your students.

Health and physical education offers students a unique opportunity for kinesthetic learning – they learn about healthy, active living primarily by “doing”, that is, through physical activity. In health and physical education, students discover the joy of movement, learn about their bodies, and develop physical and cognitive skills that will contribute to their lifelong health and well-being.

https://www.teacherspayteachers.com/Product/Kids-Yoga-1-Online-Resources-Physical-Education-DPA-Brain-Breaks-5857883

snippet.title: DJ Jingle | Holiday Song for Kids | Fun Dancing & Movement Song for Kids | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
This holiday song for kids gets your kids dancing in different styles and having lots fun together!  DJ Jingle is a holiday song for kids that features five holiday characters your kids will love: DJ Jingle, the Gingerbread Man, the Candy Cane Girl, Snazzy the Snowman and Ruby the Reindeer.

Each holiday character will engage your kids to follow them doing fun dance moves they will love to do over and over again!

DJ Jingle is a holiday song for kids that features music that kids and adults of all ages will enjoy. It can be used as a great brain breaks song for kids and is even perfect for PE classes to get everyone moving and dancing.

DJ Jingle is also a wonderful song to sing along with in the car while traveling during those holiday trips. The super catchy melody to this holiday song will help lift everyone's spirit at this special holiday time of the year, or anytime of the year!

LYRICS:
DJ Jingle

DJ Jingle, you make us wiggle
You get everybody dancing on the floor
                      DJ Jingle, you make us wiggle          Chorus
You play the hits at holiday time

Snazzy the snowman, he can really groove
He’s got his own snowman dance, it’s really cool
He’s smooth as ice from his head to his feet
Snazzy the snowman, he moves right to the beat, celebrate

Ruby the reindeer is a dancing star
Her famous dance moves are known near and far
When DJ Jingle plays a holiday song
Ruby gets the whole world to dance right along, celebrate

(Chorus)

The gingerbread man he can bust a move
Hip-hop, criss-cross and cabbage patch, too
He can even dance and do the bop
Hey gingerbread man give it all you’ve got, celebrate

Candy Cane girl, oh you’re so very sweet
Watching you dance, is a candy cane treat
You go girl, go feel the DJ play
We’re having so much fun at our holiday party, celebrate

When DJ Jingle drops the beat
Everybody gets up on their feet
Dancing, smiling, having a good time
He makes the holidays happy and bright

(Chorus)

snippet.title: Sidney the Snake. Favourite animal song from kindyRock - great songs for little kids
snippet.description:
☆☆☆
Sidney the Snake. Favourite animal song from kindyRock - great songs for little kids.

“Sidney the Snake” is a huge favourite song with preschoolers and toddlers. It’s a fun, action song for children that uses lots of animals and that they love to sing and dance along to.  It's a super easy song to sing along to and also super easy as an action and movement song for kids. With a snake the slithers, a frog that jumps, a seagull that flies, an elephant that sways and a crocodile that snaps along!


Kids love to sing and dance and move along with action songs just for children.  “Sidney the Snake” really is a great animal song. With actions and movement to suit every child’s ability.

Sing along with kindyRock creator Judi Cranston and her young friend Imogen, as she takes you through simple actions of 5 favourites animals and the way they move their bodies. The tempo gets slower at the end too, making this so much fun to sing along to. Help your children to be creative by showing them how to make up their own actions, learn new language and of course TO HAVE FUN! Children love to sing and dance to their own songs as well as kindyRock songs.

If you have landed on this Youtube channel it’s probably because you are a teacher to children aged under 7 years, you've heard about us through a school, kindergarten, daycare, yoga or music class, you're an in home educator or a parent who understands the importance of music education for children's development.  

At kindyRock we want to help support you in your teaching by providing you with Quality Music Education Resources.

As a teacher you will probably know how important and effective music is for our children’s brains and that you should be doing music regularly, even on a daily basis in your classes! If you don't feel comfortable singing, that's where we make it easy for you, guiding you and the children through these easy to remember songs, designed to support you and their learning needs.

Your children will love using their voices to sing , their hands to do the actions and their eyes to follow along with Judi Cranston. Your kids will have a blast with this exciting, silly and fun song! You can incorporate and encourage your children to join in which also helps them with rhythm and is perfect for brain breaks, circle time, group activities or those bad weather days when children can't go outside to play.

Sidney the Snake  is also easy and fun to play or pretend to play when you need a quick energy break.  When children take a moment to sing, dance, move, and even laugh, they can then return to their academics feeling happy, energized and renewed. More and more schools are realising the significant values of breaks like this in the classroom.

"Like" us on Facebook and participate in our weekly live streams, perfect for mat times or in session music education!

These top 10 #1 Best Kids Songs for Children by The Learning Station include a collection of children’s favorite and popular kids songs featuring: “If You’re Wearing Colors”, “A-Root-Chy-Cha”, “7 Days of the Week”, “Head, Shoulders, Knees and Toes”, “Tony Chestnut”, “Fill Your Bucket”, “Herman the Worm” and more favorites and best kids songs! 
“If You’re Wearing Colors” is from the CD Download by The Learning Station, “Get Funky & Musical Fun” CD Download: https://store.learningstationmusic.com/getfunkycd.aspx

LYRICS:
If You’re Wearing Colors 
Before starting the song have the children look at the color clothes they are wearing. Form a circle and start the song. Have the kids follow Don Monopoli from The Learning Station’s action movements for each color.
If you’re wearing red stand up and shake your head.
If you’re wearing green stand up and bow to the queen.
Chorus: Stand up no matter what color’s on you.
Now, sit down and clap till we sing what to do.
If you’re wearing yellow stand up and shake like Jell-O.
If you’re wearing black stand up and pat your back.
Chorus
If you’re wearing blue stand up and touch your shoe.
If you’re wearing brown stand up and spin around.
Chorus
If you’re wearing gray stand up and holler hey!
If you’re wearing white stand up and turn to the right.
Chorus
If you’re wearing tan stand up and wave your hands.
If you’re wearing purple stand up and turn in a circle.
Chorus
If you’re wearing pink stand up and wink, wink, wink.
If you’re wearing peach stand up and reach, reach, reach.
Chorus

snippet.description:
WWW.HARRYKINDERGARTENMUSIC.COM
...or find me on Teachers Pay Teachers!
www.teacherspayteachers.com/Store/Harry-­­Kindergarten-Music
HARRY KINDERGARTEN MUSIC, LLC
Hip educational songs & videos for the K-2 Classroom!

Song: IF YOU'RE A KID... (VALENTINE'S DAY REMIX)
Educational Content: This is the VALENTINE'S DAY REMIX version of my popular "If You're a Kid" song. Students can follow along in the verses as they are asked to name "things they love!"  In the chorus, everyone can "hug a friend!"


Buy! *www.harrykindergartenmusic.com
Buy! *www.teacherspayteachers.com/Store/Harry­­-Kindergarten-Music
Watch! *youtube.com/harrykindergarten
Discuss! * facebook.com/groups/harrykindergarten
Tweet! * twitter.com/harrykmusic
Logo Merchandise! * cafepress.com/harrykindergarten
Pledge! *patreon.com/harrykindergarten
Email! *pete@harrykindergartenmusic.com

HARRY KINDERGARTEN MUSIC FREEBIES:
This song is a FREEBIE. You can stream it for free on YouTube, but also buy it at my website. I am already offering 60+ of my hip educational songs/videos on YouTube FOR FREE at youtube.com/harrykindergarten. Enjoy them, utilize them, and share them! I am a current full-time Kindergarten teacher so I know what it's like to be looking around for quality content in my classroom! You can ALSO purchase the raw video file and/or audio file of those 60+ songs at my website (if you need them for some reason) or at Teachers Pay Teachers. I will continue to make freebie videos (ones you can just stream on YouTube for free) periodically, so continue to check back to see if I've posted any. 

*Please DO NOT rip any of my videos off of YouTube and upload them to your YouTube channel. I want the Harry Kindergarten Music channel to be the hotspot for these videos, not random teachers' channels who happened to illegally take them off of mine. If you really want to have a playlist of them, create a playlist from MY channel or purchase them on my website so you have the raw files. THANKS FOR UNDERSTANDING!

Q: Do you speak at conferences?
A: Yes! My ability to speak at teacher conferences during the school year is "tight" because I am currently a classroom teacher and only have a set number of personal days. However, the SUMMER time is wide-open and I'd love to come to your conference and do a session/seminar! Some of the topics I've typically spoken to teachers about include music and technology in the classroom, classroom management, running a creative morning meeting, and utilizing YouTube in the early childhood classroom. Email me at pete@harrykindergartenmusic.com to make a speaking request.

Q: Can my class perform a "Harry Kindergarten song" for an audience?
A: If you desire to have your class or group of students perform one of my “Harry Kindergarten” songs for an audience, please note that there is a $6.00 PERFORMANCE FEE.

Here are some hypothetical examples of performance groups:
* Students perform a song for an audience during a graduation ceremony.
* Students perform a song for an audience during a school or community talent show.
* Students perform a song for an audience during a school assembly.
If you are unsure if you need to purchase a performance license or not, please inquire at: pete@harrykindergartenmusic.com. If you want more details about using a song multiple years or multiple classes, etc., e-mail me for a detailed PDF file. 

$6.00 can be sent to:

Harry Kindergarten Music, LLC

508 Stewart Street

Bellwood, PA 16617

snippet.title: Seated Movement & Mindfulness for Kids!
snippet.description:
Join me for a compilation of movement and mindfulness all to be done whilst sitting down! Perfect when space is limited or for kids in classrooms sitting at desks. 

Let me know how it goes for you in the comments below! Share the fun using #cosmickidsyoga!

0:00 Jaime's Brain Breaks | Sit and Stretch - A chair-based yoga and breathing sequence ending with an inspiring visualisation!

6:21 The Listening Game  | Cosmic Kids Zen Den - Let's play a game about listening! How well can you listen to the sounds of the bells? REALLY listen! If you listen really hard, it's amazing how long they go on for. If we can get our listening working well, we can experience the world so much more and enjoy ourselves even more!

12:21 The Owl and the Guard Dog | Cosmic Kids Zen Den
This is a story explaining how certain parts of our brain work - how the amygdala (our 'guard dog') can be so good at protecting us - a little TOO good - that it stops the thinking part of our brain (our 'owl' - the pre-frontal cortex) from doing its work!

snippet.title: Wheel Chair Exercise, Adapted PE, Physical Education, DPA, Brain Breaks, Kids Fitness
snippet.description:
Move and groove with these easy to follow wheel chair exercises!!

The music in the video will inspire and motivate your students.

Health and physical education offers students a unique opportunity for kinesthetic learning – they learn about healthy, active living primarily by “doing”, that is, through physical activity. In health and physical education, students discover the joy of movement, learn about their bodies, and develop physical and cognitive skills that will contribute to their lifelong health and well-being.

snippet.title: 17 FUN BRAIN GAMES, TRICKS AND TRIVIA TO BLOW YOUR MIND
snippet.description:
Enjoy a great set of fun brain games for kids, easy tricks and cool trivia that will blow your mind into pieces:

00:14 - Bets you'll always win.
Enjoy this set of cool bets explained, so you can always win them! But let's have a bit of fun: first, you'll have time to solve these tricky bets or better say tricky riddles and then I'll show you the answer how to win the bet. I'm sure you will crack most (not all) bets on your own 😉
02:26 - Cool math trick that will guess your choice!
03:30 - Card trick for kids to blow your mind! 
04:00 - Optical illusion to shatter your mind to pieces.
05:23 - Cool optical illusion.
How many faces do you see? Where is the missing face? Cool optical illusion that will scratch your brain and crush your eyes! You won't believe what you are seeing and will pause the video to figure out what is happening in this cool riddle! Amazing tricks to learn and impress your friends around :) 
06:21 - Trivia and useful quiz.
How have I even been living without this all these years? I'm not even upset I failed almost all the questions of this quiz because now I know how it should work! A tough but undoubtedly useful quiz that will test if you use your Excel program efficiently. How many of them did you get right?
07:48 - Cool trivia question.
If you ever puzzle over how long a human can survive on different planets this amazing quiz with answers is just what you need! Take your trip around the solar system (virtually, of course!) to explore the remotest corners and impress your friends later on!
08:57 - Trivia quiz.
This unbelievable trivia quiz will puzzle your mind a lot. I bet you've never thought about these well known products in such terms! I never believed even lunar soil could be sold. What surprised you most of all in this ranking? 
12:17 - Mind blowing optical illusions.

TELL me IN THE COMMENTS which one of these brain games, easy tricks and cool trivia you liked the most and the least!

Subscribe to 7-Second Riddles: https://goo.gl/BZSTVh

snippet.title: Bedtime Yoga Set for Cosmic Kids vol2
snippet.description:
Evening Yoga Set is specially prepared for you to spend fun and productive time with your family. We start off with Brain Break to lose some of the energy before bedtime. Then we move to Yoga Pose Universe! Let's practice some of the poses, so next time you're even better at them. 
Now it's time for some Zen Den - time to concentrate and look inside, talk about feelings and understand more about what's going on in our minds. 
We finish with Peace out - deep relaxation, mindfulness and the perfect story to get sleepy exactly when needed. Night night! Namaste.

snippet.title: Penguins Make Bad Pirates | Storybook, Short Stories for Kids, Fairy Tales, Nursery Rhymes
snippet.description:
Arrrr! Desperate times calls for desperate measures, especially when your pirate ship gets stuck between two giant icebergs in the freezing Antarctic ocean. Such be the case for Captain Crabs Legs, a lonely pirate who must find a new pirate crew to help him break free and sail the seven seas, stealing pirate booty and lollipops every chance they get. Unfortunately for Captain Crab Legs, the only ones willing to help are friendly group of penguins who don’t know the first thing about sailing ships or stealing gold. Watch and read as this PlayKids original story takes you on the silliest swashbuckling adventure you’ve ever laid eyes on and discover how penguins make bad pirates!

snippet.title: Brain Breaks - 12 Days of Gym Class - Brain Breaks for Children by The Learning Station
snippet.description:
"12 Days of Gym Class", a great brain breaks song for kids. It is from the award-winning DVD & CD, Physical Ed
Physical Ed DVD: http://store.learningstationmusic.com/physicaled1.aspx
Physical Ed CD Download: http://store.learningstationmusic.com/physicaleddownload.aspx
Physical Ed CD: http://store.learningstationmusic.com/physicaled.aspx
"Let's Get Physical" free pdf download: http://learningstationmusic.com/docs/PEHandOutColor.pdf
"Like" us on Facebook and participate in FREE giveaways and freebies galore!: http://www.facebook.com/LearningStationMusic

Twelve Day of Gym Class is a great brain breaks action, dance song to make it easy and fun to take a quick energy break.  When children take a moment to sing, dance and move then they can return to their academics feeling happy, energized and renewed. Schools are realizing the significant values of brain breaks in the classroom. This brain breaks dance song is perfect for preschool, kindergarten, elementary and physical education.

Video Production by Online-Video Design: http://www.onlinevid.com/

Visit The Learning Station: https://www.learningstationmusic.com/
Visit our store!  CD's, CD Downloads, DVD's, Tee shirts & more: https://www.learningstationmusic.com/shop/

* FREE STUFF *
Sign-up for our FREE newsletter: http://learningstationmusic.com/newsletter.html
FREE printable activities: http://learningstationmusic.com/printablehandouts.html

"Physical Ed" is a PHYSICAL EDUCATION TOP PICK for motivating kids to stretch, strengthen muscles, and get healthy and fit!  

"TWELVE DAYS OF GYM CLASS" 
Copyright © Monopoli/The Learning Station
From the CD, "Physical Ed"
By The Learning Station

On the first day of gym class my coach made me do some arm flapping chicken kind of things.

On the second day of gym class my coach made me do, two pulling thumbs and some arm flapping chicken kind of things.

On the third day of gym class my coach made me do three weights for lifting, two pulling thumbs and some arm flapping chicken kind of things.

On the fourth day of gym class my coach made me do four shout outs, three weights for lifting, two pulling thumbs, and some arm flapping chicken kind of things.

On the fifth day of gym class my coach made me do five hula hoops, four shout outs, three weights for lifting, two pulling thumbs, and some arm flapping chicken kind of things.

On the sixth day of gym class my coach made me do six squatting thrusts, five hula hoops, four shout outs, three weights for lifting, two pulling thumbs, and some arm flapping chicken kind of things.

On the seventh day of gym class my coach made me do seven strokes of swimming, six squatting thrusts, five hula hoops, four shout outs, three weights for lifting, two pulling thumbs, and some arm flapping chicken kind of things.

On the eighth day of gym class my coach made me do eight ropes for climbing, seven strokes of swimming, six squatting thrusts, five hula hoops, four shout outs, three weights for lifting, two pulling thumbs, and some arm flapping chicken kind of things.

On the ninth day of gym class my coach made me do nine ways of dancing, eight ropes for climbing, seven strokes of swimming, six squatting thrusts, five hula hoops, four shout outs, three weights for lifting, two pulling thumbs, and some arm flapping chicken kind of things.

On the tenth day of gym class my coach made me do ten yards of leaping, nine ways of dancing, eight ropes for climbing, seven strokes of swimming, six squatting thrusts, five hula hoops, four shout outs, three weights for lifting, two pulling thumbs, and some arm flapping chicken kind of things.

On the eleventh day of gym class my coach made me do eleven blocks in boxing, ten yards of leaping, nine ways of dancing, eight ropes for climbing, seven strokes of swimming, six squatting thrusts, five hula hoops, four shout outs, three weights for lifting, two pulling thumbs, and some arm flapping chicken kind of things.

On the twelfth day of gym class my coach made me do twelve power punches, eleven blocks in boxing, ten yards of leaping, nine ways of dancing, eight ropes for climbing, seven strokes of swimming, six squatting thrusts, five hula hoops, four shout outs, three weights for lifting, two pulling thumbs, and some arm flapping chicken kind of things.

http://www.youtube.com/user/TheLearningStation

On the eleventh day of gym class my coach made me do eleven blocks in boxing, ten yards of leaping, nine ways of dancing, eight ropes for climbing, seven strokes of swimming, six squatting thrusts, five hula hoops, four shout outs, three weights for lifting, two pulling thumbs, and some arm flapping chicken kind of things.

On the twelfth day of gym class my coach made me do twelve power punches, eleven blocks in boxing, ten yards of leaping, nine ways of dancing, eight ropes for climbing, seven strokes of swimming, six squatting thrusts, five hula hoops, four shout outs, three weights for lifting, two pulling thumbs, and some arm flapping chicken kind of things.

snippet.title: 1-Minute Brain Break Series: Power Breath
snippet.description:
*Adult Supervision required*

This one is good for kids and parents! Take one minute when feeling overwhelmed and let everything go with 5 power breaths!
1. Standing or sitting - breathe in and raise arms above head
2. As you breath out, forcefully bend elbows bringing hands toward chest
3. Repeat as needed!

Thumbnail picture from www.yoga4classrooms.com

snippet.title: Bootcamp for Kids #2, Fitness, Exercise, Physical Education, PE, Brain Break, Daily Activity, DPA
snippet.description:
Get the Flash-Cards Here!! https://www.teacherspayteachers.com/Product/Fitness-Flash-Cards-Physical-Literacy-Exercise-PE-5907564

Get your students moving with these easy to follow exercises!! 
7 Minutes

During this video, students are expected to follow the movement instructions that are shown on the screen. Each movement activity will last for 60 seconds before changing. The music in the video will motivate and inspire your students.

Health and physical education offers students a unique opportunity for kinesthetic learning – they learn about healthy, active living primarily by “doing”, that is, through physical activity. In health and physical education, students discover the joy of movement, learn about their bodies, and develop physical and cognitive skills that will contribute to their lifelong health and well-being.

From the CD, All-Time Children's Favorites

℗©Monopoli/The Learning Station 
LYRICS:
The Wheels on the Bus (People on the Bus)
(Talk) I like to sing this song when I go for a ride with my mom. I sing it when I go on a field trip with my class. I sing it when I pretend I'm driving somewhere. Why don't we all sing it right now? YEAH!
The people on the bus go up and down, up and down, up and down. The people on the bus go up and down, all through the town.
The driver on the bus says, Move on back, move on back, move on back.  The driver on the bus says, Move on back. All through the town.
The horn on the bus goes beep, beep, beep. Beep, beep, beep.  Beep, beep, beep. The horn on the goes beep, beep, beep all through the town.
The wipers on the bus go swish, swish, swish. Swish, swish, swish. Swish, swish, swish. The wipers on the bus go swish, swish, swish, all through the town.  
The seatbelts on the bus go click, click, click. Click, click, click. Click, click, click. The seatbelts on the bus go click, click, click, all through the town.
The wheels on the bus go round and round, round and round, round and round. The wheels on the bus go round and round all through the town.
The baby on the bus goes, Wah, wah, wah. Wah, wah, wah. Wah, wah, wah, wah.  The baby on the bus goes, Wah, wah, wah, all through the town.
The mommy on the bus goes, Shhh don't cry. Shhh don't cry. Shhh don't cry.  The mommy on the bus goes, Shhh don't cry, all through the town. 
The cow on the bus goes, Moo, moo, moo. A cow! You can't fit a cow on the bus. It's too big! No! The people on the bus go up and down, up and down, up and down. The people on the bus go up and down, all through the town.

snippet.title: Multiply by 2 (Random Order) | Learn Multiplication | Multiply By Music | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
This multiplication song teaches the 2 times table and multiplication facts for 2.  This Multiply by 2 song has cool original music that is very contemporary and age appropriate for 2nd through 5th graders.  Also, this song goes through each table 1 through 12 three times to give your children a chance for lots of practice.  This Multiply by 2 song also has a gradual learning structure. 

First time: I sing the multiplication table I give the answer.

Second time: I say the table I delay the answer, so children have a chance to answer before me.

Third time: I completely omit the answer so children can answer on their own.

 We take pride in saying that this is one of the best multiplication facts songs around
This song on learning how to Multiply by 2 is a wonderful way for your children to learn and practice the multiplication tables.

Lyrics
Don't worry
Don't sweat
Don't even wonder
When you multiply by 2 you get an even number

snippet.title: 7 Tips for Motivating Middle School and High School Kids During Distance Learning
snippet.description:
Many parents have told us that motivating their kids to stay focused and engaged during distance learning is a challenge. We're thrilled to have Kristen DiCerbo, Khan Academy’s Chief Learning Officer, tackle this topic. She'll share some of the best tips to motivate elementary school kids drawn straight from educational psychology research. You can view the handout from the webinar here: http://khan.co/7TipsParentWebinar. Aquí puedes verlo en español: https://bit.ly/3dNTSX2

snippet.title: The Letter V Song ♫ Phonics Songs for Kids ♫ Learn the Alphabet ♫ Kids Songs by The Learning Station
snippet.description:
The Letter V Song and Phonics Song for Kids! In this letter sound and phonics song for kids by Don Monopoli of, The Learning Station gives the letter sound then asks the children to make that sound. Letter V, Phonics Songs for Children: Sing and learn the alphabet letters with The Learning Station.  Let’s learn about letters in the alphabet and phonics with the Letter V song video for kids. Your kids will sing, dance and learn as they explore the alphabet, how to make a letter V (upper and lower case letters), sound out the letter V (phonics for kids) and some words starting with the letter V; Violin Van Volcano and Vest!
Letter V song is geared towards toddlers, preschoolers and kindergarten age kids. 

Letter V Song (Phonics & ABC’s Songs for Kids)
by The Learning Station®  (a.k.a. Learning Station)                                                             
℗©Monopoli/The Learning Station (All rights reserved.)
LYRICS:
Letter V
Let’s learn about a letter in the alphabet. 
It’s so much fun. Let’s learn about one, letter V, letter V, letter V.
Let’s write that letter in the alphabet. It’s so much fun to draw one.
Hold your pointer finger here. Draw the letter in the air.
Follow me, and you’ll see an uppercase V, an uppercase V.
That’s an uppercase V. That’s an uppercase V.
Now a lowercase V, a lowercase V.
That’s a lowercase V. That’s a lowercase V.
Now use your voice. Let’s make the sound of the letter V.
Vv Vv Vv Vv Vv Vv Vv,  Vv Vv Vv Vv Vv Vv (All together now)
Vv Vv Vv Vv Vv Vv Vv,  Vv Vv Vv Vv Vv Vv 
Now use your eyes to see some words that begin with the letter V.
Violin Van Volcano Vest
Now we learned about the letter V, letter V, letter V, letter V.
****************************************
Your kids will have a musical blast singing and learning about the letter U. Learning about the letters in the alphabet and phonics is so much fun for kids!  The Learning Station’s Letter V Song invites kids to sing, dance and learn about the letters in the alphabet. They will learn the letter U, how to make the letter V, sounds the letter V makes (phonics) and some words beginning with the letter V.  The Letter U Song includes lyrics for early readers. 

♫ Check out our ABC’s, Phonics & Alphabet YouTube Playlists filled with learning songs galore!

snippet.title: Stay at Home Hop | Kids Dance Video | Stay Safe 🎶🎼🎤
snippet.description:
Are you stuck in the house? Well don't let that stop you from getting on your feet and get transported back to the 1950's Hops. Come on let's all go to the Hop. This video is great for families who are self isolating during the coronavirus outbreak. Be sure to continue social distancing and wash your hands to make sure everyone stays safe. Keep on Caring!

#dancesong #english #quarantineactivities
